title.narrative: % of target feeder roads improved to all-season standards.

comment.narrative: All 3 feeder roads improved to all season standard
Out of 8 target bridges 7 constructed. In one case vented causeway has been constructed instead of a bridge. There was no need ofany further bridges.

title.narrative: Share of rural population with access to an all season road [% beneficiaries from Project Area (36 direct beneficiary villages (TBC) to be placed within 2 km or 30 min of walking distance to all-seaso
% of target feeder roads maintained to all-season standards.
50% reduction in travel time of beneficiaries to key economic and social centers in the nearest town by EOP.

baseline.value: 1-15.5 hrs or 4-62 km to all-season road

comment.narrative: 78% reduction achieved, as per the final socio-economic impact monitoring study report (May 2012)

title.narrative: 10% lower basic commodity prices in project villages than in unconnected villages as a result of newly constructed roads by EOP.

baseline.value: Baseline basic commodity prices are being collectd on project roads.

title.narrative: Overall beneficiaries' satisfaction with the improved delivery of road infrastructure.

comment.narrative: 93% satisfaction level achieved as per the final socio-economic impact monitoring study (May 2012)

title.narrative: 50% reduction in transportation costs of goods and supplies from/to beneficiary villages to/from the nearest town by EOP.

baseline.value: Unit costs of human/animal transport: Nu. 0.28-0.42 Per km per kg

comment.narrative: Also 15.2 km of roads were constructed with low-cost surfacing

title.narrative: Roads in good and fair condition as a share of total classified roads

comment.narrative: no provision in the project to collect this.

title.narrative: Size of the total classified network

comment.narrative: no provision in the project to collect this.
